concept.name: arts, culture and entertainment
concept.definition: Matters pertaining to the advancement and refinement of the human mind, of interests, skills, tastes and emotions

concept.name: crime, law and justice
concept.definition: Establishment and/or statement of the rules of behaviour in society, the enforcement of these rules, breaches of the rules and the punishment of offenders. Organisations and bodies involved in these activities.

concept.name: disaster and accident
concept.definition: Man made and natural events resulting in loss of life or injury to living creatures and/or damage to inanimate objects or property.

concept.name: economy, business and finance
concept.definition: All matters concerning the planning, production and exchange of wealth.

concept.name: education
concept.definition: All aspects of furthering knowledge of human individuals from birth to death.

concept.name: environment
concept.definition: All aspects of protection, damage, and condition of the ecosystem of the planet earth and its surroundings.

concept.name: health
concept.definition: All aspects pertaining to the physical and mental welfare of human beings.

concept.name: human interest
concept.definition: Items about individuals, groups, animals, plants or other objects with a focus on emotional facets

concept.name: labour
concept.definition: Social aspects, organisations, rules and conditions affecting the employment of human effort for the generation of wealth or provision of services and the economic support of the unemployed.

concept.name: lifestyle and leisure
concept.definition: Activities undertaken for pleasure, relaxation or recreation outside paid employment, including eating and travel.

concept.name: politics
concept.definition: Local, regional, national and international exercise of power, or struggle for power, and the relationships between governing bodies and states.

concept.name: religion and belief
concept.definition: All aspects of human existence involving theology, philosophy, ethics and spirituality.

concept.name: science and technology
concept.definition: All aspects pertaining to human understanding of nature and the physical world and the development and application of this knowledge

concept.name: society
concept.definition: Aspects of the life of humans affecting its relationships

concept.name: sport
concept.definition: Competitive exercise involving physical effort. Organizations and bodies involved in these activities.

concept.name: conflicts, war and peace
concept.definition: Acts of socially or politically motivated protest and/or violence and actions to end them

concept.name: weather
concept.definition: The study, reporting and prediction of meteorological phenomena.

concept.name: arts and entertainment
concept.definition: The collective expression of message or emotion through fine or performing arts, possibly for the amusement or relaxation of people.

concept.name: animation
concept.definition: Using animated drawings, including full-length and short cinema, to express message or emotion

concept.name: cartoon
concept.definition: Still images such as editorial cartoons and comic strips to express message or emotion

concept.name: cinema
concept.definition: Moving pictures to express message or emotion

concept.name: film festival
concept.definition: National and international motion pictures festivals, selections, festival juries, nominations, awards etc.

concept.name: dance
concept.definition: The expression of emotion or message through movement of persons

concept.name: ballet
concept.definition: A classical dance form based on formal gestures, steps and postures

concept.name: modern dance
concept.definition: A theatrical dance style based on free-style expression rather than formal gestures

concept.name: traditional dance
concept.definition: A style of dance usually performed as a social activity. Encompasses folk and ceremonial dance

concept.name: fashion
concept.definition: Designing clothing and accessories to express message or emotion

concept.name: jewellery
concept.definition: Accessories to clothing

concept.name: literature
concept.definition: The expression of emotion or message through written language

concept.name: drama (literature)
concept.definition: Work written to be performed

concept.name: fiction
concept.definition: Writings that are usually not based on fact but are the creation of the author's imagination

concept.name: non-fiction
concept.definition: Writings that are based on fact

concept.name: poetry
concept.definition: The art, structure, forms of poetic expression

concept.name: music
concept.definition: Expressing emotion or message through instruments or voice using different sounds, tones, harmonies

concept.name: musical instrument
concept.definition: Objects used to play music on

concept.name: musical performance
concept.definition: Using music to entertain

concept.name: musical style
concept.definition: A distinguishable musical genre a particular type of music belongs to

concept.name: classical music
concept.definition: Music that follows classic structures of rhythm and harmony

concept.name: country music
concept.definition: Similar to folk but is unique to the United States and is less about story telling than about loves sought and lost

concept.name: folk music
concept.definition: Music that developed from folk cultures, often based on story-telling

concept.name: jazz music
concept.definition: A music of diverse harmonics, often improvised

concept.name: popular music
concept.definition: The latest fad in music, generally aimed at the younger generation

concept.name: rock and roll music
concept.definition: Popular dance music developed in the 1950s

concept.name: opera
concept.definition: A form of musical and dramatic work performed by classically trained musicians and singers

concept.name: theatre
concept.definition: Telling of a story or idea through dialogue, music and physical expression to express message or emotion

concept.name: music theatre
concept.definition: Telling of a story or idea through music, songs and further dialogue and physical expression to express message or emotion

concept.name: visual arts
concept.definition: Art forms which appeal primarily to the visual sense and typically exist in permanent form such as photography and painting

concept.name: architecture
concept.definition: Designing of buildings, monuments and the spaces around them to express message or emotion

concept.name: design (visual arts)
concept.definition: An artistic discipline which focuses on visual communication and presentation. The final product of which can range from jewellery to graphical user interfaces

concept.name: drawing
concept.definition: Using the mediums of pencils, markers, pen and ink, charcoal and the like on various grounds to express message or emotion

concept.name: painting
concept.definition: Using the mediums of oils, watercolour, pastel, crayon etc on various grounds to express message or emotion

concept.name: photography
concept.definition: Using photographic images to express message or emotion

concept.name: sculpture
concept.definition: Representation of forms in clays, stone, woods, metals or other materials to express message or emotion

concept.name: culture
concept.definition: The ideas, customs, arts, skills of a particular group

concept.name: cultural development
concept.definition: The history of the development of art and culture such as the rise of cave paintings, pre-Colombian art, Chinese paper-making, anything non-political

concept.name: customs and tradition
concept.definition: A particular way of behaving, or observances that have developed over time by a group of people

concept.name: festive event (culture)
concept.definition: All kinds of events with a specific cultural background not necessarily tied to a fixed occasion or date

concept.name: language
concept.definition: The means by which people communicate with each other

concept.name: library and museum
concept.definition: Collections of books, music, art, or objects from the past and present for public use and display

concept.name: monument and heritage site
concept.definition: Areas containing commemorative objects for historical people or events

concept.name: mass media
concept.definition: Media addressing a large audience

concept.name: news media
concept.definition: Media that collect facts about incidents, developing and presenting them to audiences as a whole story

concept.name: newspaper
concept.definition: Daily or weekly publication that present the day to day history of the world, as well as features, comics etc

concept.name: online media
concept.definition: World wide web based media delivering text, photo, graphics or streaming content

concept.name: periodical
concept.definition: Material that is usually published weekly, bi-weekly, monthly or annually for a long time

concept.name: radio
concept.definition: Programmes broadcasted by radio stations

concept.name: television
concept.definition: Programmes broadcasted by TV stations

concept.name: act of terror
concept.definition: Act of violence, often deadly, designed to raise fear and anxiety in a population

concept.name: act of bioterrorism
concept.definition: Use of biological agents to raise the level of fear within a population, whether deaths occur or not.

concept.name: bombings
concept.definition: Use of explosive devices against people, buildings or structures

concept.name: armed conflict
concept.definition: Disputes between opposing groups involving the use of weaponry, but not necessarily formally declared a war

concept.name: guerrilla activity

concept.name: military occupation
concept.definition: Taking over the control of a country or region by military forces

concept.name: missing due to hostilities
concept.definition: People, both civilian and military, missing during or after hostilities

concept.name: war

concept.name: civil war

concept.name: war crime action
concept.definition: Actions alleged as crimes committed during a war or armed conflict, usually against civilians or POW's

concept.name: civil unrest

concept.name: massacre
concept.definition: The death of a large group of people over a brief period of time

concept.name: genocide
concept.definition: Systematic killing of one clan, tribe or ethnic type by another

concept.name: peace process
concept.definition: Actions to end a war or conflict

concept.name: peace envoy
concept.definition: Person or organisation initiating a peace process

concept.name: peace plan
concept.definition: Outline for achieving peace

concept.name: peace talks
concept.definition: Discussions between the conflicting parties at different formal levels

concept.name: post-war reconstruction

concept.name: disarmament
concept.definition: Abolishing or reducing weapons

concept.name: ordnance clearance
concept.definition: The removal or neutralisation of ordnance such as landmines or cluster bombs, remaining after a war or armed conflict

concept.name: prisoners and detainees

concept.name: employment statistics
concept.definition: Statistics about employment

concept.name: exports
concept.definition: What is produced or manufactured in your country and sent and sold elsewhere

concept.name: government aid
concept.definition: Supply of financial and other help by one government, usually to another

concept.name: government debt
concept.definition: The amount a government owes on bonds, services and for goods and services for which it has no ready cash

concept.name: imports
concept.definition: What is bought abroad and brought into a country for resale

concept.name: inflation
concept.definition: A rise in prices

concept.name: interest rate
concept.definition: The amount of money one must pay to borrow money

concept.name: international economic institution
concept.definition: Entities such as UNIDO, World Bank, World Trade Organization, the Import-Expert Bank etc that deals at a world level

concept.name: international trade
concept.definition: Trade of goods and services between nations

concept.name: trade agreements
concept.definition: Government level agreements between countries for the sale and purchase of goods and services

concept.name: trade balance
concept.definition: The difference between the financial value of imports and exports

concept.name: trade dispute
concept.definition: International dispute over trade barriers, cartels, dumping etc.

concept.name: trade policy
concept.definition: Governmental decisions on tariffs, shipping, embargoes, and the types or kinds of goods and services to be imported and exported

concept.name: investments
concept.definition: Speculative purchases of corporate instruments, of commodities, currencies, or parts thereof

concept.name: money and monetary policy
concept.definition: Government bank directed policy on the amount of money in circulation and the rate at which it can be loaned

concept.name: mortgage
concept.definition: The loan of money for the purpose of purchasing a property, whether land or building. Or, for homeowners to repair or maintain properties, often based on owner equity in a property

concept.name: mutual funds
concept.definition: Pools of shares or bonds for sale often grouped by investment intention, such as growth, income or security

concept.name: prices
concept.definition: The monetary value of goods, services or stocks and bonds

concept.name: recession
concept.definition: A decrease in the GDP over a period of 2 quarters in a row.

concept.name: tariff
concept.definition: Fees placed on goods imported or exported, often punitive

concept.name: market and exchange
concept.definition: Organised entities for buying and selling stocks, currencies, commodities and other goods

concept.name: commodity market
concept.definition: The bartering or trading of goods such as cotton, oil, coal, metals, etc

concept.name: energy market
concept.definition: Energy trading and markets

concept.name: metal
concept.definition: Markets for trading base metals such as copper, aluminium, steel, zinc etc

concept.name: soft commodity
concept.definition: Trading in commodities such as cotton, sugar, sorghum, soybeans etc.

concept.name: debt market
concept.definition: Market for trading debt instruments such as bonds, CDs, bankers acceptances, T bills, notes, IOUs etc

concept.name: foreign exchange market
concept.definition: The trading of shekels, dinars, euros, dollars etc around the world through regulated markets

concept.name: loan market
concept.definition: The market where money is available to borrow, at certain rates of interest

concept.name: loans
concept.definition: An agreement by one individual or institution to temporarily disperse money to another, with an agreed rate and time for its return

concept.name: securities
concept.definition: Markets for trading types of company paper such as stocks and bonds

concept.name: derivative securities
concept.definition: Financial instruments such as futures, swaps and options, used for risk management, whose characteristics and value depend upon the characteristics and value of an underlying instrument, such as a commodity, bond, equity or currency.

concept.name: stocks
concept.definition: Corporate paper that gives an individual an ownership right to a part of a company's earnings

concept.name: parent organisation
concept.definition: Group of parents set up to support educational activities of their children

concept.name: religious education
concept.definition: Instruction by any faith, in that faith or about other faiths, usually, but not always, conducted in schools run by religious bodies

concept.name: school
concept.definition: A building or institution in which education of various sorts is provided

concept.name: elementary schools
concept.definition: Schools usually of a level from kindergarten through 11 or 12 years of age

concept.name: further education
concept.definition: Any form of education beyond basic education of several levels

concept.name: adult education
concept.definition: Education provided for older students outside the usual age groups of 5-25

concept.name: high schools
concept.definition: Pre-college/ university level education, 14 to 17 or 18 years of age, called freshman, sophomore, junior and senior

concept.name: higher education
concept.definition: Education above secondary level, usually provided by colleges and universities, which results in a professional qualification or academic degree

concept.name: college
concept.definition: Institution of higher learning, its specific scope is set differently in different countries

concept.name: university
concept.definition: Institutions of higher learning capable of providing doctorate degrees

concept.name: middle schools
concept.definition: Transitional school between elementary and high school, 12 through 13 years of age

concept.name: preschool
concept.definition: Education for children under the national compulsory education age

concept.name: social learning
concept.definition: Learning social competence from parents and others as one grows up

concept.name: teaching and learning
concept.definition: Either end of the education equation

concept.name: curriculum
concept.definition: The courses offered by a learning institution and the regulation of those courses

concept.name: examination
concept.definition: A measurement of student accomplishment

concept.name: entrance examination
concept.definition: Exams for entering colleges, universities, junior and senior high schools, and all other higher and lower education institutes, including cram schools, which help students prepare for exams for entry to prestigious schools.

concept.name: students
concept.definition: People of any age in a structured environment, not necessarily a classroom, in order to learn something

concept.name: teachers
concept.definition: People with knowledge who can impart that knowledge to others

concept.name: climate change
concept.definition: Significant change in measures of climate (such as temperature, precipitation, or wind) lasting for an extended period

concept.name: global warming
concept.definition: This category includes all issues relating to global warming including temperature research, remote sensing on temperature trends, debate on global warming, ways to reduce emissions and carbon trading.

concept.name: conservation
concept.definition: Preservation of wilderness areas, flora and fauna, including species extinction

concept.name: energy saving
concept.definition: Conservation of electrical, and other power sources

concept.name: parks
concept.definition: Areas set aside for preservation

concept.name: environmental politics
concept.definition: The debate on environmental policy

concept.name: environmental pollution
concept.definition: Corruption of air, water, land etc. by harmful substances

concept.name: air pollution
concept.definition: Solid or gaseous matter affecting the quality of air that we breathe

concept.name: environmental cleanup
concept.definition: Processes whereby contaminated areas are cleaned of hazardous materials so they can be inhabited again by either people or animals.

concept.name: hazardous materials
concept.definition: Materials that are harmful to humans or animals if they are exposed to them. Includes radiation, poison gases, chemicals, heavy metals, PCBs, and certain plant products

concept.name: waste materials
concept.definition: The environmental impact of waste, including recycling efforts

concept.name: water pollution
concept.definition: Solids or liquids that corrupt the quality of water that could be used for drinking or irrigation

concept.name: natural resources
concept.definition: Environmental issues related to the exploitation of natural resources

concept.name: energy resources
concept.definition: Such resources as coal, gas, wind, sunlight etc., used to generate heat, electricity and power

concept.name: land resources
concept.definition: That portion of a nation or state that is above water and available for development either for profit or for the general good of the public

concept.name: forests
concept.definition: Open areas of trees either available for public enjoyment, or for commercial purposes

concept.name: mountains
concept.definition: Elevated land masses formed over the ages either by erosion, volcanic eruption, or movement of massive geographical formations called plates

concept.name: population growth
concept.definition: People and their growth and development within a natural setting

concept.name: renewable energy
concept.definition: The environmental impact of renewable energy, including solar, wind, hydro, biomass and geothermal

concept.name: water
concept.definition: Environmental issues about bodies of water, including oceans, lakes, streams and reservoirs, as well as ice, glaciers and forms of precipitation

concept.name: oceans
concept.definition: Salt water masses separating continents or other major geographical masses. smaller forms are seas or lakes or ponds

concept.name: rivers
concept.definition: Moving water areas bounded by land that extend from earth sources and meander through land areas to join with other water areas. In smaller forms they are creeks, rivulets, streams etc

concept.name: wetlands
concept.definition: Areas generally marshy and not either under water or dry land. Often related to aquifers for water quality and/or wildlife

concept.name: nature
concept.definition: The natural world in its entirety

concept.name: ecosystem
concept.definition: A system of plants, animals and bacteria interrelated in its physical/chemical environment

concept.name: endangered species
concept.definition: Those species in danger of disappearing, largely because of changes in environment, hunting, or weather

concept.name: invasive species
concept.definition: Non-native plants, animals and other organisms that tend to take over native species

concept.name: diseases and conditions
concept.definition: Any harmful or destructive health condition affecting humans.

concept.name: cancer
concept.definition: A serious and often fatal disease caused when normal cells mutate into tumours

concept.name: communicable disease
concept.definition: Diseases that can be transmitted from one person or animal to another

concept.name: epidemic
concept.definition: An epidemic is a rapidly spreading condition in a community.

concept.name: plague (disease)
concept.definition: A highly infectious epidemic disease caused by the Yersinia pestis bacteria

concept.name: virus disease
concept.definition: Diseases caused by infection within cells by viruses

concept.name: AIDS
concept.definition: Acquired Immunity Deficiency Syndrome, an incurable disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus

concept.name: retrovirus
concept.definition: A family of RNA viruses such as those causing leukaemia and AIDS

concept.name: heart disease
concept.definition: A degenerative and serious disease caused by narrowing of the arteries feeding the heart

concept.name: illness
concept.definition: Non-specific maladies such as stomach aches, headaches, flat feet, lumbago

concept.name: injury
concept.definition: A traumatic condition of the human body caused usually by outside forces

concept.name: medical conditions
concept.definition: Various stages of disease, illness or injury

concept.name: mental and behavioural disorder
concept.definition: Illnesses and disorders affecting the mind and behaviour

concept.name: eating disorder
concept.definition: Anorexia, bulimia, overeating and similar illnesses

concept.name: obesity
concept.definition: A condition of body weight generally considered 20 percent above the norm for gender, age, height and bone structure

concept.name: health facility
concept.definition: Facilities used for any kind of healthcare

concept.name: hospital and clinic
concept.definition: Medical facilities for the treatment of illnesses and injury

concept.name: health organisations
concept.definition: Specific health organisations, including professional associations, non-profit and international groups

concept.name: health treatment
concept.definition: In general treatment of diseases and other conditions to produce wellness

concept.name: diet
concept.definition: Controlled food consumption

concept.name: dietary supplements
concept.definition: Nutrients taken in addition to food to bolster health

concept.name: medical drugs
concept.definition: Chemical substances used in the diagnosis, treatment or prevention of physical and mental disease

concept.name: prescription drugs
concept.definition: Drugs that can be purchased only with a doctor's authorisation

concept.name: medical procedure/test
concept.definition: Any of a variety of treatments such as stress tests, catherisation, blood tests, computerised axial tomography scan or magnetic resonance imaging

concept.name: medicine
concept.definition: A substance used with the expectation that it will eliminate disease or illness

concept.name: herbal medicine
concept.definition: Treatment based on the use of herbs and other plants to cure or alleviate disease symptoms

concept.name: holistic medicine
concept.definition: Treatment of the whole person including mental and social factors rather than just the symptoms of the disease.

concept.name: traditional Chinese medicine
concept.definition: The practice of diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease based on traditional methods developed in the orient.

concept.name: western medicine
concept.definition: The practice of diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease based on modern scientific research in the western hemisphere.

concept.name: physical fitness
concept.definition: The condition of the body of a person.

concept.name: preventative medicine
concept.definition: Substances used to prevent diseases or illnesses

concept.name: vaccines
concept.definition: Medications designed to create immunity to diseases

concept.name: therapy
concept.definition: Treatment of physical, mental or medical conditions by non-surgical means

concept.name: healthcare policy
concept.definition: Health-related policy decisions including what different countries are doing regarding prescription drug policies, AIDS, psychiatric care, health care funding and related topics.

concept.name: government health care
concept.definition: Health care provided by national governments

concept.name: Medicaid
concept.definition: A program of the U.S. government to provide health care to needy citizens of all ages
concept.note: This US-specific entity is not appropriate for Media Topics. The general concept of government-provided health care is covered by the parent.

concept.name: Medicare
concept.definition: A program of the U.S. government to provide health care to senior citizens
concept.note: This US-specific entity is not appropriate for Media Topics. The general concept of government-provided health care is covered by the parent.

concept.name: health insurance
concept.definition: Insurance covering extraordinary medical costs

concept.name: private health care
concept.definition: Health care provided by privately funded or insured organisations

concept.name: medical profession
concept.definition: Profession requiring formal training in the study, diagnosis, treatment, care and prevention of disease, medical condition or injury.

concept.name: medical service
concept.definition: Medical support for doctors, including blood tests and other medical tests on individuals, X-rays CAT scans MRIs etc.

concept.name: medical specialisation
concept.definition: The different medical specialist areas.

concept.name: geriatric medicine
concept.definition: Speciality into ageing and age-related issues including age-related illnesses, medical research, and trends.

concept.name: obstetrics/gynaecology
concept.definition: Specialty of female reproductive organs

concept.name: paediatrics
concept.definition: Speciality of medicine for the young - includes premature babies, infant care, childhood disease and treatment - also teen-related health and behaviour problems.

concept.name: reproductive medicine
concept.definition: Speciality of reproductive technologies like invitro fertilisation

concept.name: medical staff
concept.definition: Doctors, nurses, interns and others in a medical facility

concept.name: non-human diseases
concept.definition: Any harmful or destructive health condition affecting animals, plants or microorganisms.

concept.name: animal disease
concept.definition: Disease affecting animals

concept.name: plant disease
concept.definition: Disorders affecting plants caused either by parasites or environmental factors

concept.name: accomplishment
concept.definition: Achievements by individuals or groups, animals, plants or other objects, such as winning a competitive contest etc

concept.name: award and prize
concept.definition: Decorations, awards and prizes, including those given by the government.

concept.name: records and achievements
concept.definition: Non-sport achievement by an individual or group that sets a new record, such as most books read, holding your breath longest

concept.name: animal
concept.definition: Items about animals with a focus on emotional facets

concept.name: ceremony
concept.definition: Rituals of a non-religious nature such as dedications, wreath laying, ship launchings etc

concept.name: people
concept.definition: Individuals or groups with a focus on emotional facets

concept.name: human mishap
concept.definition: Silly or stupid human errors

concept.name: high-society
concept.definition: Life and behaviour of well-known people

concept.name: celebrity
concept.definition: Life and behaviour of famous people

concept.name: imperial and royal matters
concept.definition: Imperial and royal family members in their societal rather than governmental roles.

concept.name: plant
concept.definition: Items about plants with a focus on emotional facets

concept.name: employment
concept.definition: Working for an organisation, an individual or being self-employed, including voluntary work

concept.name: apprentices
concept.definition: People who are in the work force at a learning level, serving under a master

concept.name: child labour
concept.definition: Employment of children, usually under the age of 18

concept.name: employee
concept.definition: A person who trades his time and talent for money and other benefits

concept.name: employer
concept.definition: The person who employs workers and pays the salaries and other benefits to workers

concept.name: employment training
concept.definition: Learning skills required for employment

concept.name: advanced training
concept.definition: Additional training to enhance current skills

concept.name: retraining
concept.definition: Providing a worker training in new skills when his old skills are no longer applicable

concept.name: occupations
concept.definition: Generally one's trade, profession or business although professions are usually such things as lawyers and doctors, and occupations are such as clerks or truckers

concept.name: wage and benefit
concept.definition: Employee compensation.

concept.name: employee benefits
concept.definition: Benefits provided to an employee by a company, such as pension contributions, health insurance.

concept.name: social security
concept.definition: FICA. Money paid by individual and companies into a government account to be paid out when that individual reaches a certain age

concept.name: employment legislation
concept.definition: Laws governing employment

concept.name: health and safety at work
concept.definition: Rules and procedures for guaranteeing the health of workers

concept.name: labour market
concept.definition: A pool of people who are working or are seeking work

concept.name: labour relations
concept.definition: The give and take between management and employees

concept.name: collective contract
concept.definition: Usually written contracts covering a specific class of worker

concept.name: contract issue-healthcare
concept.definition: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on health care issues

concept.name: contract issue-wages
concept.definition: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on remuneration

concept.name: contract issue-work rules
concept.definition: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on rules affecting issues such as lunch and other breaks, work shifts, vacation scheduling, seniority, sick leave etc.

concept.name: labour dispute
concept.definition: Differences in opinion about work conditions, pay, etc

concept.name: strike
concept.definition: A job action involving cessation of work

concept.name: retirement
concept.definition: The years after work

concept.name: pension
concept.definition: Payments to a retired person.

concept.name: unemployment
concept.definition: Having no work but being able to work

concept.name: job layoffs
concept.definition: The reduction of a company's work force through dismissal because of changing economic factors

concept.name: unemployment benefits
concept.definition: Monetary compensation paid to the jobless.

concept.name: unions
concept.definition: Groups established to represent bodies of workers

concept.name: leisure
concept.definition: Activities carried out in ones' spare time and not in a competitive way.

concept.name: club and association
concept.definition: Organisations joined by individuals because of similar interests

concept.name: game
concept.definition: Contests generally for one's amusement

concept.name: board game
concept.definition: A game played on a board

concept.name: card game
concept.definition: A game played with a pack of cards

concept.name: children's game
concept.definition: A game designed for and most often played by children

concept.name: dice game
concept.definition: A game played using dice only

concept.name: outdoor game
concept.definition: A game played in an open space

concept.name: puzzle
concept.definition: A game played solving logic problems for entertainment

concept.name: tile game
concept.definition: A game played using tiles

concept.name: video game
concept.definition: A game played using a video display

concept.name: gaming and lottery
concept.definition: Gambling, often involving selection of sets of numbers one expects to come up

concept.name: hobby
concept.definition: Recreational pursuit

concept.name: holiday
concept.definition: Time spent not at work for rest and relaxation

concept.name: public holiday
concept.definition: A day off for celebrations declared by authorities

concept.name: leisure venue
concept.definition: A place where people go to be entertained or amused

concept.name: amusement park
concept.definition: A park providing various rides and entertainment attractions for both adults and children, including theme parks

concept.name: bar
concept.definition: A business where drinks are prepared and served to the public for consumption on the premises

concept.name: cafe
concept.definition: A small business where drinks and snacks are prepared and served - its specifics may depend on the local culture

concept.name: nightclub
concept.definition: A commercial establishment providing music, or other entertainment along with food and drink to selected clientele

concept.name: restaurant
concept.definition: A business where meals are prepared and served to the public

concept.name: sports facilities
concept.definition: Gymnasiums, stadiums or arenas where sports events take place

concept.name: recreational activities
concept.definition: Out of work activities done for pleasure or relaxation

concept.name: fishing
concept.definition: A recreational activity involving the use of baits, lures, weapons and traps for the capture of aquatic species.

concept.name: hunting
concept.definition: An activity involving the use of weapons or traps for the capturing of animals

concept.name: travel
concept.definition: Leisure travel

concept.name: tourism
concept.definition: Leisure travel involving visits to a number of locations and/or countries over an extended period of time, often as part of an organised group

concept.name: lifestyle
concept.definition: Unique culture of one's own home

concept.name: automobile enthusiasm
concept.definition: Interest in new and classic cars

concept.name: bicycle enthusiasm
concept.definition: Interest in new and classic manpowered cycles

concept.name: food and drink
concept.definition: Interest in eating and drinking

concept.name: organic food
concept.definition: Food which is grown using no artificial fertilisers or chemical compounds

concept.name: house and home
concept.definition: Interest in houses, apartments and their decoration, including furnishings

concept.name: motorbike enthusiasm
concept.definition: Interest in new and classic of motor powered cycles

concept.name: trend
concept.definition: Interest in developments in style, fashion and design

concept.name: election
concept.definition: The selection of representatives by the casting of votes

concept.name: citizens initiative and recall
concept.definition: Political suggestions by non-government officials for corrective action, or for changes in existing rules and regulations

concept.name: electoral system
concept.definition: Voting systems

concept.name: intergovernmental elections
concept.definition: Choosing individuals for government for an intergovernmental body

concept.name: local elections
concept.definition: Choosing individuals for government at the basic level, whether city, village or county

concept.name: national elections
concept.definition: Choosing individuals for government at a national level

concept.name: political campaigns
concept.definition: Campaigns for public office

concept.name: campaign finance
concept.definition: The money that makes campaigns for public office possible

concept.name: political candidates
concept.definition: Individuals who are chosen to stand for office

concept.name: primary elections
concept.definition: Preliminary elections on a local or regional basis leading up to a regional or national election

concept.name: referenda
concept.definition: Political proposals, laws and actions suggested by non-government officials to be voted on by the entire voting body

concept.name: regional elections
concept.definition: Choosing individuals for government at a regional level

concept.name: voting
concept.definition: The act of selecting an individual you would like to represent your interests in government

concept.name: fundamental rights
concept.definition: The political, social and economic rights to which all creatures are entitled, usually upheld by law.

concept.name: censorship
concept.definition: Attempts by any group to control freedoms of speech, religion, and ideas distributed in print, graphics, cyberspace and other ways. Does not include official standards such as cinema ratings, advertising and broadcast standards.

concept.name: freedom of religion
concept.definition: Religious rights and freedoms, pressure and intimidation of the believers, censorship in mass media, activities of government bodies, journalistic associations and/or organisations and other NGOs in regards to freedom of belief and practice

concept.name: freedom of the press
concept.definition: Mass media rights and freedoms, pressure and intimidation of the journalists, censorship in mass media, activities of government bodies, journalistic associations and/or organisations and other NGOs in regards to press freedom

concept.name: human rights
concept.definition: Rights entitled to be enjoyed by all citizens universally

concept.name: government
concept.definition: The system for ruling a country

concept.name: civil and public service
concept.definition: The paid service by civilians for the government, and the often non-paid service of individuals for the benefit of others (public service)

concept.name: public employees
concept.definition: People employed by a government at all levels

concept.name: public officials
concept.definition: Individuals, usually elected, who are in public service or commonly in the public eye.

concept.name: constitution (law)
concept.definition: Usually a written document setting forth the operations of a government and the rights of the citizens therein

concept.name: defence
concept.definition: Anything involving the protection of one's own country

concept.name: armed forces
concept.definition: Those employed by a government to conduct war, or to enforce the security of a nation

concept.name: veterans affairs
concept.definition: Care and provision for those who served in the military

concept.name: military equipment
concept.definition: Equipment issued to members of the armed forces

concept.name: military weaponry
concept.definition: A country's collection of armaments

concept.name: security measures (defence)
concept.definition: Means of making a nation, a state, a building or a person secure from harm and outside interference.

concept.name: national security
concept.definition: The philosophy of securing a nation and its borders, as well as the well being of its citizens

concept.name: espionage and intelligence
concept.definition: Covert collection of information

concept.name: executive (government)
concept.definition: That portion of a ruling body involving the overall operation of government

concept.name: government budget
concept.definition: The expenses and revenues approved by the legislature.

concept.name: public finance
concept.definition: The money of government used for paying for public programs and services and public debt

concept.name: government department
concept.definition: Divisions of a government that concentrate on specific areas such as health, welfare, economy or war

concept.name: heads of state
concept.definition: Symbolic or actual chief representative of a nation, such as royalty, or president or emir, for example

concept.name: impeachment
concept.definition: The process of bringing a public official before a tribunal to answer charges of wrongdoing

concept.name: local government and authority
concept.definition: Authorities at borough, city or county level

concept.name: ministers (government)
concept.definition: Heads of various government departments at one level, also known as secretaries. At another level they form a legislative body. The chief minister is either prime minister or premier.

concept.name: national government
concept.definition: The ruling body of a nation

concept.name: parliament
concept.definition: The collective body of elected officials representing the people

concept.name: lower house (parliament)
concept.definition: The lower chamber of a legislative body

concept.name: upper house (parliament)
concept.definition: Senior chamber of a legislative body

concept.name: regional government and authority
concept.definition: Authorities at a level above the local and below the national one. Could be named a state, province, department etc.

concept.name: safety of citizens
concept.definition: Government policies to protect the well being of its citizens

concept.name: taxation
concept.definition: A levy to fund government expenditure

concept.name: government policy
concept.definition: An overall plan or course of action set out by a government intended to influence and guide decisions and actions towards a desired outcome.

concept.name: nationalisation
concept.definition: State takeover of private companies or properties

concept.name: privatisation
concept.definition: The transfer of state-owned companies or properties to private owners

concept.name: state-owned enterprise
concept.definition: The government as owner of companies, either complete or partial

concept.name: interior policy
concept.definition: Government policies affecting internal affairs

concept.name: data protection policy
concept.definition: Efforts to protect personal information in either written, oral or electronic form

concept.name: housing and urban planning policy
concept.definition: Systematic planning of urban and suburban areas and the housing within those areas

concept.name: policy towards indigenous people
concept.definition: Government policies toward indigenous peoples

concept.name: pension and welfare policy
concept.definition: Government policies affecting the well being of its citizens through unemployment benefits, state pensions and other similar payments

concept.name: personal data collection policy
concept.definition: The collection, by government or other entities of information on individuals

concept.name: personal weapon control policy
concept.definition: Government control of personal ownership of firearms and other offensive weapons, including control of weapons used for sports through licenses and other means

concept.name: planning inquiries
concept.definition: Public hearings or planning inquiries on proposed constructions, e.g. Construction of water driven power station in a National Park.

concept.name: migration of people
concept.definition: Movement of one body of persons from one place to another

concept.name: nuclear policy
concept.definition: Government policies as regards to use of nuclear fuels for power production or weapons

concept.name: regulatory of industry
concept.definition: The rules and bodies, both national and international, that govern conflict of interest and good practice regulations.

concept.name: food and drink regulations
concept.definition: Government policies relating to food and drink

concept.name: international relations
concept.definition: Non-violent relations between nations through negotiation, treaty, or personal meetings

concept.name: diplomacy
concept.definition: The use of verbal and written skills for persuading others to your point of view

concept.name: summit meetings
concept.definition: Includes meetings of leaders, foreign and finance ministers from the Group of Eight major nations and Group of Seven industrialized nations.

concept.name: treaty
concept.definition: A treaty (as defined by the Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties) is a written agreement between international entities that is binding under international law.

concept.name: economic sanction
concept.definition: Punitive actions taken by one country against another including trade restrictions, embargoes etc.

concept.name: foreign aid
concept.definition: Help provided by one nation to another

concept.name: international organisation
concept.definition: Includes organisations with members and functions that cross international borders, and may include intergovernmental organisations of sovereign nations.

concept.name: refugees and internally displaced people
concept.definition: A person seeking shelter in another country because of some fear of persecution in his own country

concept.name: non-governmental organisation
concept.definition: Groups officially outside of government that lobby, demonstrate or campaign on a wide range of issues such as economics, environment healthcare etc.

concept.name: political crisis
concept.definition: Conflict that rises to a level where, depending on events, governments can fall etc

concept.name: political dissent
concept.definition: Disagreement between political groups, usually organised and sometimes resulting in imprisonment of the dissenters

concept.name: political process
concept.definition: The art or science of participating in the affairs of government, a state of political party

concept.name: lobbying
concept.definition: The attempt by non-government bodies and individuals to affect the outcome of legislation through verbal, or other, persuasion

concept.name: political parties and movements
concept.definition: Covers both formally recognised and informal political associations

concept.name: political development
concept.definition: The creation and rise of political systems and the history of the people and nations that are associated with those systems.

concept.name: political system
concept.definition: System designed to provide order to government

concept.name: democracy
concept.definition: Government in which the people hold the power either directly, or through elected officials.

concept.name: dictatorship
concept.definition: Government in which a single individual or a small group of individuals hold power without consent of the people

concept.name: religious belief
concept.definition: The established beliefs of an individual's religion

concept.name: Buddhism
concept.definition: A major Asian religion founded by Buddha in the 6th century BC in India and preaching that right thinking and self denial will lead to a divine state without desire

concept.name: Christianity
concept.definition: Those that use Jesus Christ and his teachings as their centre of belief

concept.name: ecumenism
concept.definition: Relations between Christian churches

concept.name: Mormon
concept.definition: Members of a religious community which believes in the 'Book of Mormon' and the revelations of founder M.J. Smith

concept.name: Old Catholic
concept.definition: Members of a catholic church which started in 1870 and denies the dogma of the infallibility of the pope

concept.name: Orthodoxy
concept.definition: Eastern rite churches which are characterised by their continuity with the apostolic church, their liturgy and their territorial churches, mainly in eastern and south-eastern Europe and the Middle East

concept.name: Protestant
concept.definition: General term for Christian churches and religious communities which developed through the reformation in the 16th century

concept.name: Anglican
concept.definition: Members of the worldwide Anglican communion which started in the 16th century in England as a breakaway church from the roman catholic church

concept.name: Baptist
concept.definition: Members of a Christian church which only baptises adults who truly believe in Christ

concept.name: Lutheran
concept.definition: Christians who follow the teaching of reformer Martin Luther

concept.name: Mennonite
concept.definition: Members of a 16th century Christian church which is against military service and baptising infants

concept.name: Methodist
concept.definition: Followers of John and Charles Wesley who tried to reform the Church of England in the 18th century and turned into a separate church

concept.name: Reformed
concept.definition: Christians who follow the teaching of reformers Johannes Calvin and Ulrich Zwingli

concept.name: Roman Catholic
concept.definition: Biggest Christian church worldwide tracing its origins back to Jesus Christ

concept.name: concordat
concept.definition: Treaty between the Holy See and another country for the regulation of ecclesiastical affairs in the territory of the latter

concept.name: Confucianism
concept.definition: The way of life propagated by Confucius in the 6th-5th century BC and followed by the Chinese people for more than 2000 years. Its influence has extended to Korea, Japan, and Vietnam.

concept.name: cult and sect
concept.definition: Offshoots of established religious bodies, or small narrow-focused group promulgated by one or two individuals

concept.name: Freemasonry
concept.definition: A secret international society based on the principles of brotherhood, charity and mutual aid

concept.name: Hinduism
concept.definition: A religious and social system, believing in a caste system with the Brahmans the highest and untouchables the lowest.

concept.name: Islam
concept.definition: Those who use Allah and his teachings as their centre of belief

concept.name: Jainism
concept.definition: A religion of India that teaches a path to spiritual purity and enlightenment through a disciplined mode of life founded upon the tradition of ahimsa, nonviolence to all living creatures. It began in the 7th-5th century BC.

concept.name: Judaism
concept.definition: A group believing in one god, basing their beliefs on written scriptures and the Talmud, including the first coming of the Messiah

concept.name: nature religion
concept.definition: Worship of natural elements like fire, water, trees, mountains

concept.name: Parsasm
concept.definition: A religion in India following the Iranian prophet Zoroaster, mainly in Bombay, but also in Karachi (Pakistan).

concept.name: Scientology
concept.definition: Believe that man is a spiritual being endowed with abilities well beyond those which he normally envisages

concept.name: Shintoism
concept.definition: Indigenous religious beliefs and practices of Japan. The word Shinto came into use in order to distinguish indigenous Japanese beliefs from Buddhism.

concept.name: Sikhism
concept.definition: The religion of an Indian group, combining Hindu and Islamic elements, founded in the Punjab (or Punjab) in the late 15th century AD by Guru Nanak.

concept.name: Taoism
concept.definition: Indigenous religio-philosophical tradition that has shaped Chinese life for more than 2000 years

concept.name: Unificationism
concept.definition: The belief system of members of the Unification Church established by the Rev. Sun Myung Moon.

concept.name: interreligious dialogue
concept.definition: Any form of communication between religions

concept.name: religious conflict
concept.definition: Conflicts involving religious differences

concept.name: religious event
concept.definition: News regarding a religious event but not a festival or holiday

concept.name: religious festival or holiday
concept.definition: Holy day or day of observance in a religion which sometimes is a public holiday as well

concept.name: Christmas
concept.definition: Christian festival in commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ

concept.name: Easter
concept.definition: Christian festival in commemorating the resurrection of Jesus Christ

concept.name: Pentecost
concept.definition: Christian festival, celebrated on the 50th day after Easter commemorating the descent of the Holy Spirit

concept.name: Ramadan
concept.definition: Holy month of fasting in Islam

concept.name: Yom Kippur
concept.definition: Most solemn of Jewish religious holidays, observed on the 10th day of the lunar month of tishri (in the course of September and October, when Jews seek reconciliation with god

concept.name: religious ritual
concept.definition: Established religious rituals such as mass, baptism, prayer meetings

concept.name: religious facilities
concept.definition: Any facility where a group can carry out its religious rites whether it is a mosque, a church, a house or a tent

concept.name: church
concept.definition: Generally an edifice identifiable as a place of worship for the Christian religion

concept.name: mosque
concept.definition: Generally an edifice identifiable as a place of worship for the Islamic religion

concept.name: synagogue
concept.definition: Generally an edifice identifiable as a place of worship for the Jewish religion

concept.name: temple
concept.definition: Generally an edifice identifiable as a place of worship

concept.name: religious institutions and state relations
concept.definition: The legal and social division between religious institutions and the affairs of state

concept.name: religious leader
concept.definition: Person or persons who have a ritual, juridical or otherwise leading role in their respective church or religion

concept.name: pope
concept.definition: Head of the roman catholic church worldwide

concept.name: religious text
concept.definition: Scriptures holy or important for a church or religion

concept.name: Bible
concept.definition: Sacred scriptures of Christianity consisting of the old and new testament

concept.name: Qur'an
concept.definition: Holy book of Islam

concept.name: Torah
concept.definition: Holy scriptures of Judaism

concept.name: biomedical science
concept.definition: The application of biology-based science to medical use, be it research, health monitoring or treatment

concept.name: biotechnology science
concept.definition: Manipulating natural organisms for scientific, medical or agricultural purposes

concept.name: dentistry
concept.definition: The study of the medical condition of teeth

concept.name: pharmacology
concept.definition: The study of drugs

concept.name: veterinarian science
concept.definition: The study of medical conditions of animals

concept.name: mathematics
concept.definition: The study of quantity, structure, space, and change. Also the relationships between these concepts using symbolic logic and language. Includes geometry, arithmetic, algebra, trigonometry, calculus and statistics.

concept.name: mechanical engineering
concept.definition: The study and application of the design, construction and operation of mechanical systems

concept.name: natural science
concept.definition: The sciences (physics, chemistry, or biology) that deal with matter, energy, and their interrelations and transformations or with objectively measurable phenomena. Specifically excluding mathematics.

concept.name: astronomy
concept.definition: The study of solar systems and stars

concept.name: biology
concept.definition: The study of living organisms

concept.name: botany
concept.definition: The study of plants

concept.name: genetics
concept.definition: The study of heredity and functioning of basic building blocks of organisms.

concept.name: palaeontology
concept.definition: The study of prehistoric life forms, geological periods and fossils

concept.name: physiology
concept.definition: The study of vital processes of living organisms

concept.name: zoology
concept.definition: The study of animals

concept.name: chemistry
concept.definition: The study of the composition and reaction of substances

concept.name: cosmology
concept.definition: The study of the organisation and structure of the universe

concept.name: geology
concept.definition: The study of Earth's physical processes

concept.name: horticulture
concept.definition: The study and art of plant cultivation

concept.name: marine science
concept.definition: The multi-disciplinary research areas involving the worlds' waterways and oceans. This could include hyper-spectral sensing of ice flows, fisheries studies and underwater research.

concept.name: meteorology
concept.definition: All scientific aspects of the weather and climate.

concept.name: physics
concept.definition: The study of the properties and changes of matter

concept.name: electromagnetism
concept.definition: A branch of physics covering the behaviour and interaction of electricity and magnetism

concept.name: nuclear physics
concept.definition: A field of physics which studies the structure and behaviour of atomic nuclei

concept.name: particle physics
concept.definition: The study of elementary particles and atomic nuclei through the use of high-energy particles

concept.name: research
concept.definition: Methodical investigation of events, procedures etc to explain why they occur, or to find solutions for problems

concept.name: discovery and innovation
concept.definition: Detecting and learning something new and the creation, development and implementation of a product or process.

concept.name: medical research
concept.definition: Investigation into the causes and cures of diseases

concept.name: scientific exploration
concept.definition: Methodical land, sea and space journeys to discover new information about them

concept.name: space programme
concept.definition: The government's organised effort for the exploration of outer space and the bodies therein

concept.name: scientific paper
concept.definition: Academic research findings which have been published in an article, book or thesis

concept.name: scientific institutions
concept.definition: Institutions that carry out or govern scientific work (e.g. National Academy of Arts and Sciences )

concept.name: social sciences
concept.definition: The study of people living in groups, as families, tribes and communities

concept.name: anthropology
concept.definition: The study of human beings in groups or societies

concept.name: archaeology
concept.definition: Probing the past through ruins and artefacts

concept.name: economics
concept.definition: The study of the laws and principles of economy

concept.name: geography
concept.definition: The study of the surface of Earth and its political divisions

concept.name: history
concept.definition: The study of human events of the past

concept.name: information science
concept.definition: The study of collecting, classifying, storing, retrieving and disseminating information

concept.name: study of law
concept.definition: The study of legal systems and the philosophy of law

concept.name: linguistics
concept.definition: The study of language.

concept.name: philosophy
concept.definition: Ideas and thoughts about the way the world works

concept.name: political science
concept.definition: The study of principles of political systems

concept.name: psychology
concept.definition: The study of the human mind and mental and emotional processes

concept.name: sociology
concept.definition: The study of human social relations, organisation and change

concept.name: scientific standards
concept.definition: The rules, national and international, that govern science and technology. These might include international standards setting for equipment and interference standards.

concept.name: technology and engineering
concept.definition: The study of the practical or industrial arts, and applied sciences such as physics, hydrodynamics and thermodynamics

concept.name: aerospace engineering
concept.definition: The development and design of all kinds of aircrafts and spacecrafts

concept.name: rocketry
concept.definition: The development and design of all kinds rockets

concept.name: agricultural technology
concept.definition: Pertaining to the growing of crops and management of farm animals

concept.name: civil engineering
concept.definition: The study and application of the design and construction of structures

concept.name: electronics
concept.definition: The study and application of the design, construction and operation of systems built on the exchange of electric charges

concept.name: identification technology
concept.definition: Includes biometrics, new computer-based identification cards, retinal scans, face scanning and mobile augmented reality systems (MARS) and other ways technology can identify individuals. Also technology vs. the privacy of personal information.

concept.name: IT/computer sciences
concept.definition: The study and design of computer systems and networks.

concept.name: material science
concept.definition: The study of materials used in manufacturing

concept.name: micro science
concept.definition: The multi-disciplinary areas of nanotechnology and Micro-Electrical Mechanical Systems.

concept.name: nanotechnology
concept.definition: Manipulating objects at the molecular scale

concept.name: communities
concept.definition: A group of individuals actively sharing a common value or interest

concept.name: social networking
concept.definition: Building communities of people, including using online media.

concept.name: demographics
concept.definition: The study of people and here they live and how they interact

concept.name: immigration
concept.definition: Movement of individuals from one country to the other

concept.name: emigrants
concept.definition: People who leave their country of origin, their relationship with their country of origin and their association with fellow emigrants

concept.name: illegal immigrants
concept.definition: Movement of individuals from one country to the other by illicit means

concept.name: population and census
concept.definition: Population is the number of people in a geographical region and census is the process of counting them

concept.name: discrimination
concept.definition: Denial of services to one or more people because of race, colour, sexual identity, religion, political beliefs etc

concept.name: ageism
concept.definition: Harmful attitudes toward another group based on different ages

concept.name: racism
concept.definition: Harmful attitudes toward another group based on racial differences

concept.name: religious discrimination
concept.definition: Harmful attitudes toward another group based on differences in belief or faith

concept.name: sexism
concept.definition: Harmful attitudes toward another group based on gender differences

concept.name: family
concept.definition: A group of individuals related by blood or marriage

concept.name: adoption
concept.definition: A legal process of bringing a child with no supporting parents into a supportive union

concept.name: courtship
concept.definition: Preliminaries of wooing and winning a partner

concept.name: divorce
concept.definition: The process by which a marriage is dissolved

concept.name: family planning
concept.definition: Conscious decisions and efforts involving reproduction

concept.name: abortion
concept.definition: Usually the planned disruption of the process of reproduction of human life

concept.name: marriage
concept.definition: The union of two individuals who pledge fidelity, respect and support for each other

concept.name: parent and child
concept.definition: Two or more individuals with a hierarchical familial relationship

concept.name: mankind
concept.definition: Individuals as a whole, sometimes broken down into various classes, such as indigenous people, people of class etc

concept.name: adults
concept.definition: People above an age set by law as acquiring full liability

concept.name: children
concept.definition: Immature people, usually up to the age of puberty

concept.name: disabled
concept.definition: Being incapacitated either physically, emotionally or mentally

concept.name: gays and lesbians
concept.definition: Those that consider themselves attracted to their same gender in an erotic or sensual or similar way.

concept.name: gender
concept.definition: The classification of individuals as either male or female.

concept.name: infants
concept.definition: Those people from birth until ages of one or two, usually when they begin walking

concept.name: national or ethnic minority
concept.definition: Groups of people that form a minority on ethnic or national basis, their status, problems and relations to the majority

concept.name: nuclear radiation victims
concept.definition: Includes antinuclear movements and compensation for atomic blast victims.

concept.name: senior citizens
concept.definition: People having passed the age of retirement

concept.name: teenagers
concept.definition: People at an age between childhood and adulthood

concept.name: social condition
concept.definition: Conditions under which people live in terms of housing, water supply, availability of education

concept.name: homelessness
concept.definition: Lacking a fixed place of residence

concept.name: poverty
concept.definition: Having insufficient resources to provide for basic services to oneself or family

concept.name: social problem
concept.definition: Issues affecting the lives of individuals

concept.name: abusive behaviour
concept.definition: The maltreatment of one or more individuals by others through dehumanising treatment including sexual or mental abuse, deprivation of sensory abilities, deprivation of physical needs, physical mistreatment including beatings, and other forms of torture

concept.name: addiction
concept.definition: The habitual and often uncontrollable use of harmful substances such as alcohol, tobacco and pharmaceuticals or drugs

concept.name: juvenile delinquency
concept.definition: Incidents involving perpetrators who are minors.

concept.name: prostitution
concept.definition: Sex for sale, either male or female, and those who profit from it

concept.name: slavery
concept.definition: The involuntary servitude, outside of legal incarceration for statuary criminal offences, of men, women and children, including involuntary unpaid labour, coerced actions, child labour

concept.name: values
concept.definition: Levels of behaviour and its community acceptance.

concept.name: corrupt practices
concept.definition: Any action which is harmful to others

concept.name: death and dying
concept.definition: Social issues relating to death and dying.

concept.name: euthanasia
concept.definition: Aiding the death of a terminally ill person

concept.name: assisted suicide
concept.definition: Death by one's own hand with the help of another person

concept.name: suicide
concept.definition: Death by one's own hand

concept.name: ethics
concept.definition: A system of beliefs about acceptable behaviour

concept.name: pornography
concept.definition: Audio or visual or textual depictions of various sex related acts considered outside accepted community standards

concept.name: sexual behaviour
concept.definition: Sexual behaviour of individuals or groups

concept.name: welfare
concept.definition: Help for those in need of food, housing, health and other services

concept.name: charity
concept.definition: Philanthropic giving

concept.name: long term care
concept.definition: Extensive health care because of serious illness or disability

concept.name: social services
concept.definition: Supported programmes to improve the well-being of individuals or groups of individuals

concept.name: competition discipline
concept.definition: Different types of sport which can be executed in competitions

concept.name: American football
concept.definition: Team ball game that opposes two teams that have attack sections and defence sections. Each attack goes up against the other defence and attempts to move an oval-shaped ball down the field and into the end-zone to mark a touchdown and earn points.

concept.name: archery
concept.definition: Archers use bows and arrows to aim at targets 1.22 metres in diameter which are on average 70 metres distant.

concept.name: crossbow shooting
concept.definition: Shooting with crossbow on targets from different distances

concept.name: longbow
concept.definition: Shooting with longbow on targets from different distances. The competition is held outdoors on an open (flat) field.

concept.name: athletics, track and field
concept.definition: Competitions involving foot races, jumping and throwing which can be on a track inside a stadium or on outside roads

concept.name: cross country run
concept.definition: Competitors run over rough ground and not on a track

concept.name: decathlon
concept.definition: Individual men's competition which involves accumulating points in 10 different disciplines over two days: 1st day - 100m, long-jump, shot-putt, high-jump, 400m. 2nd day - 110m hurdles, discus, pole-vault, javelin and 1,500 metres.

concept.name: discus throw
concept.definition: Competitors throw a hammer consisting of a metal ball, chain and handle as far as they can from a netted circle which is 2.13 metres in diameter. The hammer weighs 7.26 kg for men and 4 kg for women

concept.name: hammer throw
concept.definition: Competitors stand in a netted circle with a 2.50 metres diameter and with a turning motion attempt to throw a discus weighing 2kg for men and 1kg for women as far as possible.

concept.name: heptathlon
concept.definition: Individual women's competition involving seven separate disciplines over two days. 1st day - 100m hurdles, high-jump, shot-putt, 200 metres. 2nd day - long-jump, javelin, 800 metres.

concept.name: high jump
concept.definition: Competitors build up speed over a short sprint and then jump as high as possible over a horizontal bar

concept.name: hurdles
concept.definition: A sprint running race where athletes jump over a series of upright frames

concept.name: javelin throw
concept.definition: Competitors in a specially-designated throwing area attempt to fling a spear-like javelin as far as possible. The javelin weighs 800 grammes for men and 600 grammes for women.

concept.name: long distance run
concept.definition: A running race at distances for more than 1500 metres

concept.name: long jump
concept.definition: Competitors build up speed over a short sprint and then jump in one leap as far as possible

concept.name: middle distance run
concept.definition: A running race at distances for more than 400 metres and up to and including 1500 metres

concept.name: pentathlon
concept.definition: Only indoor, 60m hurdles, high jump, shot put, long jump, 800 m

concept.name: pole vault
concept.definition: Competitors use a flexible pole to propel themselves feet-first into the air and clear a bar which is raised higher at each round of jumps.

concept.name: race walking
concept.definition: A race requiring the competitor to have always one foot on the ground

concept.name: relay run
concept.definition: A team of athletes run a relay over identical distances

concept.name: shot put
concept.definition: Competitors stand in a circle with a 2.13 metres diameter and attempt to throw a metal ball weighing 7.26 kg for men and 4kg for women as far as possible. The longest throw wins.

concept.name: sprint run
concept.definition: A running race at distances of up to and including 400 metres

concept.name: triple jump
concept.definition: Competitors build up speed over a short sprint and then attempt to jump as far forward as they can using a hop, skip and a jump technique.

concept.name: Australian rules football
concept.definition: Football played under Australian rules

concept.name: badminton
concept.definition: Two players or two teams of two compete by hitting a shuttlecock weighing approximately five grams over a high net. The aim for each player/team is to prevent the shuttlecock landing on their side of the court.

concept.name: bandy
concept.definition: Played outdoors on ice. The size of the ice rink is about the size of a soccer field. Skates like ice hockey. A small hard ball is used for playing. Players play with sticks, much like in ice hockey, but the sticks are shorter and more rounded than in ice

concept.name: baseball
concept.definition: A game between two teams of nine played on an enclosed ground. The team which scores the most points wins. A point is scored when a player runs around the ground marked out by four bases. To do this he has to hit the ball thrown at him by a rival player w

concept.name: rubberball baseball
concept.definition: Sometimes called ''soft baseball,'' the game is played with a rubber baseball of varying degrees of hardness depending upon the age and level of the players.

concept.name: basketball
concept.definition: Game played between two teams of five - points are scored by placing the large inflated ball into a net fixed on a ring 3.05m above the ground.

concept.name: biathlon
concept.definition: A combination of cross country skiing and target shooting on a 12.5 K course in a pursuit format.

concept.name: billiards
concept.definition: A cue sport with balls on a table without a specific order to play them

concept.name: bobsleigh
concept.definition: In bobsleigh two or four persons race down a course sitting in a sled that consists of a main hull, a frame, two axles and sets of runners. The total time of all heats in a competition is added together to determine the winner.

concept.name: bowls and petanque
concept.definition: A game in which players throw bowls at a target, the winner being the player who lands closest.

concept.name: boxing
concept.definition: Combat sport in which two men/women fight using only their fists covered by padded gloves in a square ring measuring 6m a side. The fight is usually split into 12 rounds of three minutes each.

concept.name: bantamweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: cruiserweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: featherweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: flyweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: heavyweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: light flyweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: light-heavyweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: light-middleweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: light-welterweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: lightweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: middleweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: straw weight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: super-bantamweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: super-featherweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: super-flyweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: super-heavyweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: super-middleweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: welterweight (boxing)
concept.definition: Weight category which varies according to the federation or the Olympic Games

concept.name: bullfighting
concept.definition: Classical contest pitting man against the bull

concept.name: Canadian football
concept.definition: Gridiron football played under Canadian rules

concept.name: canoeing
concept.definition: Competition involving canoes which are generally kneeled and paddled with a single-bladed paddle

concept.name: C1 (canoeing)
concept.definition: One-seater canoe (open boat with competitor using a single bladed paddle

concept.name: C2 (canoeing)
concept.definition: Two-seater canoe (open boat) - competitors use a single bladed paddle

concept.name: C4 (canoeing)
concept.definition: Four-seater canoe (open boat) with each competitor using a single bladed paddle

concept.name: canoe sailing
concept.definition: A race involving a canoe equipped with a sail.

concept.name: pontoniering
concept.definition: Team sport, military tradition, similar to canoe regatta, in boats

concept.name: casting (fishing)
concept.definition: Using fishing equipment to hit a target and score points

concept.name: mountain climbing
concept.definition: Moving up mountains using hands and feet

concept.name: ice climbing
concept.definition: Climbing of ice features such as icefalls and frozen cliffs

concept.name: mountaineering
concept.definition: Alpine climbing

concept.name: sport climbing
concept.definition: Sport climbing as a special category: individual competition, on an artificial wall with time measurement

concept.name: cricket
