concept.definition: Ball sport involving two teams of 11 players, balls, bats and wickets. The aim is to score as many runs as possible, and to get the opposing team 'out'. A 'run' involves a player running between two wickets. The opposing team try to get their rivals 'out'

concept.name: croquet
concept.definition: Using mallets to hit a ball through hoops

concept.name: curling
concept.definition: A game played on ice with large flat round stones. A player throws the stone, aiming at a target. Teammates of the player who has thrown the stone can sweep the ice in front of the stone to help smooth its path towards the target.

concept.name: icestock sport
concept.definition: Similar to curling, played on targets on ice, different stones with straight handle and different rules, played in alpine countries

concept.name: cycling
concept.definition: A race over a given distance on bicycles.

concept.name: artistic cycling
concept.definition: Individual or teams on one or two bicycles in an arena. Points are awarded by a jury.

concept.name: bi-crossing
concept.definition: A race where competitors have to cover a circuit with obstacles as quickly as possible.

concept.name: bmx
concept.definition: Bicycle racing in with inline start and various obstacles over off-road circuits.

concept.name: cycle ball
concept.definition: Competitive team sport using bicycles. One team against another with two persons per team. The aim is for competitors to move the ball using the front and rear wheels without letting their feet touch the ground.

concept.name: cycle sprint race
concept.definition: Track cycling race between two cyclists over two or three laps, with a timed sprint finish over the last 200m

concept.name: cyclo-cross
concept.definition: Staged on various surfaces - earth, grass, sand or tarmac.

concept.name: individual pursuit (cycling)
concept.definition: Track cycling event where two cyclists set off from midway down opposite straights and try to make up the gap between them

concept.name: individual time trial (cycling)
concept.definition: A race or stage against the clock with each cyclist setting off individually

concept.name: Keirin
concept.definition: Sprint between six cyclists where a pacemaker on a moped gradually increases the pace over the first 1400m. When the pacemaker leaves the track the race develops into a sprint finish over the final 6-700m.

concept.name: Madison race
concept.definition: A points race by teams comprising two cyclists in relay-format

concept.name: mountain biking
concept.definition: All-terrain, off-road bicycle riding requiring endurance and specially adapted mountain bikes

concept.name: points race (cycling)
concept.definition: Cyclists aim to complete the highest number of laps. Bonus points are picked up in intermediate sprints held every 2500m

concept.name: road cycling
concept.definition: Road race with all the competitor starting en masse.

concept.name: cycling staging race
concept.definition: Race disputed by teams with the classifications determined by the combined times over a day

concept.name: team cycle sprint
concept.definition: A track race where two teams race against each other, starting on opposite sides of the track, following the first lap the first rider pulls away, leaving the second rider to lead the next lap, who then does the same at the last lap, leaving the third rider to finish the race. The team with the fastest time is the winner.

concept.name: road cycling team pursuit
concept.definition: Track cycle event where two teams set off from midway down opposite straights and try to make up the gap between them

concept.name: team time trial (cycling)
concept.definition: Teams of cyclists race against the clock

concept.name: track race (cycle)
concept.definition: A race staged on a track in a velodrome

concept.name: competitive dancing
concept.definition: Dancing competition where couples are judged on technique and interpretation.

concept.name: darts
concept.definition: The sport in which small darts are thrown at a dartboard, a circular target divided into numbered sections.

concept.name: diving
concept.definition: Competitors dive off a fixed or spring board and are assessed by seven judges giving marks up to ten for their acrobatic moves.

concept.name: platform diving
concept.definition: Divers take off from a high platform

concept.name: springboard diving
concept.definition: Divers dive from a high springboard.

concept.name: synchronised diving
concept.definition: Two competitors from the same team dive off at the same time from separate platforms or springboards. As well as being judged on the standard criteria they are also awarded marks for synchronisation.

concept.name: scuba diving
concept.definition: Diving into different depths, with time measurement

concept.name: subaquatics
concept.definition: Sports like hockey held under water

concept.name: dog racing
concept.definition: Dogs racing around a track

concept.name: oval track dog racing
concept.definition: Pursuing an artificial rabbit around an oval track

concept.name: dog sled racing
concept.definition: Race with dogs harnessed to a sled

concept.name: duathlon
concept.definition: An athletic event involving running and cycling

concept.name: equestrianism
concept.definition: Sport involving a horse and rider.

concept.name: cross country horse riding
concept.definition: Equestrian event held on a designated circuit in the countryside featuring artificial and natural obstacles.

concept.name: dressage
concept.definition: A rider is judged on a series of moves at three different paces - walk, trot and gallop.

concept.name: horse jumping
concept.definition: A rider and horse attempt to jump a series of obstacles in an enclosed arena against the clock.

concept.name: three day eventing
concept.definition: Equestrian event involving three disciplines - Dressage, cross-country and show jumping

concept.name: horse driving
concept.definition: Equestrian events involving horses being driven in harness, single vehicle around a course.

concept.name: fencing
concept.definition: Combat sport using a sword or foil.

concept.name: epee
concept.definition: Category of fencing using a weapon with a triangular cross-section blade and a large bell guard

concept.name: foil
concept.definition: Category of fencing using a weapon with a rectangular cross-section blade and a small bell guard

concept.name: sabre
concept.definition: A fencing weapon with a flat blade and knuckle guard used with cutting or thrusting moves

concept.name: field hockey
concept.definition: A ball sport involving two teams of 11 players using curved sticks. The aim is to score as many goals as possible.

concept.name: figure skating
concept.definition: To obtain the best marks possible from nine judges who award scores after two prepared sections - both skated to music - during which competitors must attempt to achieve the greatest possible harmony between artistic flair and technical precision.

concept.name: ice dance
concept.definition: Takes place over three days with, in order, two compulsory dances, the original dance (2min 30sec) and the free dance (4min).

concept.name: fist ball
concept.definition: Men's team sport similar to volleyball (with a much lower net) executed mainly in gymnastics clubs

concept.name: floorball
concept.definition: Played indoors in a court the size of a basketball court. 6 players per team, of which one is a goalkeeper. He/she operates kneeling but there is no goal-stick like in ice hockey. The players use plastic clubs and a light plastic ball to pass and shot goal

concept.name: flying disc
concept.definition: A group of events all played with a flying plastic disc. The exact regulation for the disc is different in different events but it has to be unbroken of solid plastic and a production model with no modification. Flying disc is sometimes called Frisbee.

concept.name: Gaelic football
concept.definition: A game originating in Ireland, where two teams of fifteen compete to score a goal through the H-shaped goals either by kicking the ball or striking it with the hand. The team with the most points wins.

concept.name: golf
concept.definition: A game to hit a small hard ball with different clubs around a course of typically 18 holes varying in distance and during a round. The object, depending on the scoring formulae, is to make the fewest strokes possible.

concept.name: mini golf
concept.definition: A game where small hard balls must be holed on an artificial course in as few strokes from the club as possible

concept.name: gymnastics
concept.definition: A sport consisting of a variety of disciplines in which gymnasts perform artistic and acrobatic moves using different apparatus.

concept.name: ball (rhythmic gymnastics)
concept.definition: An exercise based on suppleness of the body using a ball.

concept.name: beam (artistic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Gymnasts perform leaps and flips from the much feared balance beam just 10 cm wide.

concept.name: clubs (rhythmic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Dance and gymnastic moves whilst juggling clubs.

concept.name: floor exercise (artistic gymnastics)
concept.definition: A gymnastics floor exercise on a 12m/sq matt.

concept.name: hoop (rhythmic gymnastics)
concept.definition: A hoop is rolled and thrown whilst performing a dance routine.

concept.name: horizontal bar (artistic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Gymnasts turn, spin and perform pirouettes around the horizontal bar.

concept.name: parallel bars (artistic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Gymnasts swing and turn with guile and grace around the parallel bars.

concept.name: pommel horse (artistic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Gymnasts perform an uninterrupted swing motion over a handled horse using balance and strength

concept.name: rhythmic gymnastics
concept.definition: Mixture of dance and gymnastic moves

concept.name: ribbon (rhythmic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Gymnasts work through a pre-arranged routine whilst manipulating a spectacular length of ribbon.

concept.name: rings (artistic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Gymnasts perform feats of balance and strength from two suspended rings.

concept.name: rope (rhythmic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Jump and figure movements are performed while a rope is manipulated.

concept.name: trampoline
concept.definition: Competitors perform complicated twists and turns whilst bouncing on the trampoline.

concept.name: uneven bars (artistic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Gymnasts run through an airborne routine swinging around and between the uneven bars.

concept.name: vault (artistic gymnastics)
concept.definition: Gymnasts propel themselves by jumping on a trampoline after running quickly down a 25m lane

concept.name: handball (team)
concept.definition: A ball game using the hands contested by two teams of seven trying to throw the ball into the opponents goal.

concept.name: hornuss
concept.definition: Swiss team sport with 16 or 18 men per team. A rubber puck is hit towards the field of the adversary team which tries to hit the puck in the air with a wooden board thrown in the air

concept.name: horse racing
concept.definition: Mounted horse races.

concept.name: flat racing
concept.definition: A horse race over a flat course.

concept.name: harness racing
concept.definition: Horses hitched to a jockeyed buggy race round a flat course. Can be performed at a trotting gait or a pacing gait.

concept.name: steeple chase
concept.definition: A mounted horse race over at least eight classic obstacles, four of which must be different, such as the water jump, spruce fences, mud walls etc.

concept.name: hurling
concept.definition: A game played by two teams of fifteen each with a curved wooden stick called a hurley. The object is to score a goal by hitting the small ball between the opponents' goalposts either over the crossbar or under it into a net guarded by a goalkeeper.

concept.name: ice hockey
concept.definition: Two teams of six heavily padded skaters try and outscore each other by hitting a puck into the opponents goal.

concept.name: sledge hockey
concept.definition: Like ice hockey but instead of skates small sledges are used. Competitors move by pushing with the arms

concept.name: inline skating
concept.definition: Competitive sports using inline skates

concept.name: Jai Alai (Pelota)
concept.definition: A fast ball play using either the bare hand or a wicker scoop in an arena of walls of different outlay and size

concept.name: judo
concept.definition: A defensive martial art.

concept.name: extra lightweight (judo)
concept.definition: Up to 60kg for men and 48kg for women.

concept.name: half-heavyweight (judo)
concept.definition: Up to 100kg for men and 78kg for women.

concept.name: half-lightweight (judo)
concept.definition: Up to 73kg for men and 57kg for women.

concept.name: half-middleweight (judo)
concept.definition: Up to 81kg for men and 63kg for women

concept.name: heavyweight (judo)
concept.definition: Open but usually over 100kg for men and over 78kg for women

concept.name: lightweight (judo)
concept.definition: Up to 66kg for men and 52kg for women.

concept.name: middleweight (judo)
concept.definition: Up to 90kg for men and 70kg for women.

concept.name: jukendo
concept.definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a model rifle made of wood. 'Juken' means a rifle or gun with blade (bayonet).

concept.name: kabaddi
concept.definition: The attacking side scores by touching, and the side to guard scores by capturing. The attacker continues calling it 'kabaddi'.

concept.name: kayaking
concept.definition: Competition involving kayaks where the paddler sits with their legs facing forward using a double-bladed paddle

concept.name: K1 (kayaking)
concept.definition: An enclosed boat with the competitor sitting on a fixed seat for one person using a double bladed paddle

concept.name: K2 (kayaking)
concept.definition: An enclosed boat with the competitor sitting on a fixed seat for two people using double bladed paddles

concept.name: K4 (kayaking)
concept.definition: An enclosed boat with the competitor sitting on a fixed seat for four people using double bladed paddles

concept.name: karate
concept.definition: A martial art where chops, punches, kicks and throws are used to defeat an opponent.

concept.name: kendo
concept.definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a bamboo sword, sometimes called Japanese fencing.

concept.name: kyudo
concept.definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a bamboo bow and arrows, sometimes called Japanese archery.

concept.name: lacrosse
concept.definition: Two teams of helmeted and padded players try and outscore each other using a netted stick and hard ball.

concept.name: luge
concept.definition: Luge (French word for sled) is competed in singles or doubles. The competitor(s) lay on their back on an open sled and race down a course. The competitor(s) and the sled must be in contact when passing the finishing line. The competitor can steer the sled

concept.name: marathon
concept.definition: A road race where competitors run 42.195km, generally through city streets

concept.name: modern pentathlon
concept.definition: The Modern Pentathlon comprises five events run over a single day in the following order: shooting, fencing, swimming, horse riding and running.

concept.name: motorboat racing
concept.definition: Racing with boats with engines

concept.name: motor car racing
concept.definition: Racing with cars

concept.name: endurance race
concept.definition: Races for one or more drivers over a long and set distance or time

concept.name: F3000
concept.definition: Using less powerful motors than the Formula One, designated construction teams race over varied circuits the world over in speed races for individual and team honours over a season.

concept.name: Formula One
concept.definition: Single cockpit car racing where 20 or so competitors race head to head over varied circuits around the world to win Grand Prix points in an individual and constructors championship

concept.name: Indy Racing
concept.definition: North American top range professional league speed racing over circuits.

concept.name: motor car rallycross
concept.definition: Stage races over dirt tracks

concept.name: motor car rallying
concept.definition: A season of endurance races over closed circuits including dirt tracks, roads and even snowy conditions featuring specials using adapted road cars with a driver and co-pilot.

concept.name: motorcycling
concept.definition: Races with 2, 3 or 4 wheels vehicles with a saddle and handlebars

concept.name: motorcycle endurance
concept.definition: A road race of consistency and endurance

concept.name: enduro
concept.definition: A race of speed, endurance and regularity over varied surfaces such as through forests and on dirt tracks

concept.name: grass-track
concept.definition: A race competed on turf

concept.name: moto-ball
concept.definition: Team sport where drivers play a ball

concept.name: moto-cross
concept.definition: Raced over dirt tracks featuring severe mounds

concept.name: motoGP
concept.definition: Capacity class 1000ccm

concept.name: motorcycle rallying
concept.definition: Races run over regular roads

concept.name: side-cars
concept.definition: Of different engine sizes but attached to a side car featuring a passenger

concept.name: speedway
concept.definition: Race involving up to six riders competing over a flat oval track. Speedway motorcycles use only one gear and have no brakes

concept.name: motorcycling trial
concept.definition: A race of consistency and endurance over varied terrain

concept.name: naginata
concept.definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a pole sword made of wood. 'Naginata' means a spear with a curved blade.

concept.name: netball
concept.definition: A woman's sport similar to basketball though without a board behind the basket

concept.name: orienteering
concept.definition: An individual time-trial over a route marked out by beacons. The competitor has to search out and find in a specific order. The contestant makes his way with the help of a compass and map

concept.name: ski orienteering
concept.definition: An individual ski time-trial over a route marked out by beacons, that the competitor has to search out and find in a specific order. The contestant makes his way with the help of a compass and map

concept.name: parachuting
concept.definition: Jumping from an aeroplane using a parachute, competitions are precision landings, voltige, individual and team

concept.name: polo
concept.definition: With the aid of a mallet two teams of four horsemen try and knock a bamboo ball into the opponents goal over a pitch 250m long and 150m wide. The game is divided into 4, 6, or 8 time periods of 7min 30sec called chukkas.

concept.name: pool
concept.definition: A cue sport on a table with pockets, played with different numbers of balls

concept.name: power boating
concept.definition: Races between motor boats on rivers or lakes

concept.name: rodeo
concept.definition: A discipline where wild horses or bulls must be mounted and mastered

concept.name: bareback bronc
concept.definition: Rodeo discipline

concept.name: barrel racing
concept.definition: Rodeo discipline

concept.name: bull riding
concept.definition: Rodeo discipline

concept.name: bulldogging
concept.definition: Rodeo discipline

concept.name: calf roping
concept.definition: Rodeo discipline

concept.name: goat roping
concept.definition: Rodeo discipline

concept.name: saddle bronc
concept.definition: Rodeo discipline

concept.name: roller hockey
concept.definition: Team sport similar to ice hockey, executed on 4 wheel roller skates with sticks and a ball

concept.name: rowing
concept.definition: Boat racing usually on flat calm waters with boats for 1, 2, 4 or 8 rowers

concept.name: coxed four
concept.definition: Four person boats with just one oar each and with a team mate to give directions

concept.name: coxed pair
concept.definition: Two person boats with just one oar each and with a team mate to give directions

concept.name: coxless four
concept.definition: Four person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

concept.name: coxless pair
concept.definition: Two person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

concept.name: double sculls
concept.definition: Two person boats with two oars each

concept.name: coxed eight
concept.definition: Eight person boats with just one oar each and with a team mate to give directions

concept.name: quadruple sculls
concept.definition: Four person boats with two oars each and without a team mate to give directions

concept.name: single sculls
concept.definition: Single person boats with two oars

concept.name: rugby league
concept.definition: Two teams of 13 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

concept.name: rugby union
concept.definition: Two teams of 15 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

concept.name: rugby 7
concept.definition: A more fun and exciting variety where two teams of 7 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

concept.name: sailing
concept.definition: Sailing boat racing over a route

concept.name: multihull
concept.definition: Sailing boats with multiple hulls

concept.name: dinghy
concept.definition: Single hulled vessel without a fixed keel

concept.name: keelboat
concept.definition: Single hulled vessel with a fixed keel

concept.name: sailing regatta
concept.definition: Sailing event

concept.name: ocean sailing
concept.definition: Sailing vessels across oceans as part of a competitive race.

concept.name: round the world race
concept.definition: Sailing vessels around the world as a race

concept.name: solo ocean sailing
concept.definition: Sailing oceans as an individual, as part of a race.

concept.name: non-stop solo race
concept.definition: Races either clockwise or anti clockwise around the globe without stopping at any ports between start and finish of race.

concept.name: sepak takraw
concept.definition: The game like volleyball which must not use a hand. The ball made of rattan is used.

concept.name: shinty
concept.definition: A ball game involving 2 teams with curved sticks called camans. The object is to score goals by hitting the small leather ball through the goals.

concept.name: sport shooting
concept.definition: Precision sport using a hand gun, rifle or shotgun

concept.name: pistol shooting
concept.definition: Shooting event using a pistol

concept.name: rifle shooting
concept.definition: Shooting event using a rifle

concept.name: running target shooting
concept.definition: Shooting event with an airgun and a target that moves sideways

concept.name: shotgun shooting
concept.definition: Shooting event using a shotgun

concept.name: clay pigeon shooting
concept.definition: Shooting event which involves shooting at special flying targets, known as clay pigeons or clay targets

concept.name: skeleton
concept.definition: In skeleton the competitor lay on his/hers stomach when racing down the course. The competitor must be on the sled when crossing the finishing line. The total time of all races in a competition is added together. Skeleton is considered the first sliding s

concept.name: skiing
concept.definition: A winter sport using different types of skis

concept.name: alpine skiing
concept.definition: Racing downhill on snow-covered slopes using alpine techniques and equipment. The slopes contain intermediate gates which are spaced according to the discipline involved.

concept.name: freestyle skiing
concept.definition: Competitors perform a series of breathtaking acrobatic leaps from a prepared jump. Combined with moguls, jumps and ski ballet.

concept.name: grass skiing
concept.definition: Alpine skiing on roller skis and grass

concept.name: Nordic skiing
concept.definition: Practiced in relatively-flat, snowy countryside and based on power and endurance.

concept.name: ski jumping
concept.definition: Competitors descend a snow covered elevated ramp on skis and try to fly off it as far as possible, receiving marks for distance, style of flight and landing

concept.name: sky diving
concept.definition: Parachuting competitions with long distance falls without using a parachute

concept.name: snooker
concept.definition: A cue sport with balls on a table to be potted in a specific order

concept.name: snowboarding
concept.definition: Practiced with a single board (rather than two skis)

concept.name: soccer
concept.definition: Two teams of eleven try to kick or head a ball into the opponents goal over a match usually of 90 minutes

concept.name: softball
concept.definition: Similar to baseball but with a larger and softer ball, a thinner bat, shorter gaps between bases and less innings

concept.name: speed skating
concept.definition: Timed races competed by two skaters at a time on an oval ice track

concept.name: squash
concept.definition: A racquet sport of strategy and endurance played by singles or doubles teams in a walled court with a small rubber ball

concept.name: sumo wrestling
concept.definition: A combat sport of speed and rapidity with much ceremony where two contestants try to throw or slap a competitor out of a marked area. Generally practiced in Japan by large men.

concept.name: surfing
concept.definition: Water sport where contestants catch and ride waves upright on a surfboard

concept.name: swimming
concept.definition: A water sport where contestants swim as fast as possible in a given style and win races by being the first to touch home

concept.name: backstroke
concept.definition: Swimming style, on the back, legs move in flapping motion whilst arms propel the swimmer forward

concept.name: breaststroke
concept.definition: Swimming style , on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

concept.name: butterfly swimming
concept.definition: Swimming style , swum on the front with the shoulders remaining parallel to the water both arms moving in simultaneous windmill fashion, the legs remain together and are moved in a flapping motion. The most physical of all styles.

concept.name: freestyle swimming
concept.definition: Any swimming style may be employed, though front crawl is universally employed

concept.name: medley swimming
concept.definition: A combination of four different swimming styles in one race.

concept.name: marathon swimming
concept.definition: A long distance open water swimming

concept.name: relay freestyle swimming
concept.definition: Team of swimmers swim a relay in the swimming style of their choice

concept.name: relay medley swimming
concept.definition: Team relay race involving a combination of four different swimming styles

concept.name: short course swimming
concept.definition: Races competed in a 25m length pool

concept.name: synchronised free routine
concept.definition: In the free programme, music, movements and their order of execution are not restricted.

concept.name: synchronised technical routine
concept.definition: Contestants obtain points from 10 sitting judges by executing certain synchronised artistic shapes and movements in the water. In the technical programme, competitors must execute a range of specific moves in a given order.

concept.name: table tennis
concept.definition: A racquet sport for two or four (in doubles), who compete at a table divided by a net using a small bat to play a lightweight ball

concept.name: Taekwon-Do
concept.definition: A martial art of Korean origin

concept.name: tennis
concept.definition: A sport where two players, four in doubles, equipped with a racket compete by hitting the ball over a net into the opponent's side of the court with the aim of putting it out of reach within the regulation lines, thus winning points.

concept.name: ten pin bowling
concept.definition: A game in which a player scores points by trying to knock down ten 'pins' using a ball - if unsuccessful the player has a second attempt. A game consists of ten frames.

concept.name: triathlon
concept.definition: An endurance multi-sport where competitors first swim, then cycle and then run a road race. Distances vary according to the competition.

concept.name: tug-of-war
concept.definition: Two teams pulling against each other on a rope

concept.name: volleyball
concept.definition: Two teams of six record points by hitting a ball over a net into the opponent's half of the court, keeping it in the air at all times. Points are won when opponents fail to return the ball.

concept.name: beach volleyball
concept.definition: Two teams of two players compete on a sand court. Unlike indoor volleyball, points are scored only when the serving team wins a rally or forces an error. The sand surface makes it more physically demanding than volleyball

concept.name: water polo
concept.definition: Played in a pool between two teams of 7, who must stay afloat and can only use one hand to pass the ball or swim with it before trying to throw it into the opponents net to score goals.

concept.name: water skiing
concept.definition: On one or two skis contestants are pulled by a power boat along the water's surface

concept.name: weightlifting
concept.definition: A strength test where competitors lift as heavy a weight as possible

concept.name: clean and jerk (weightlifting)
concept.definition: The bar is first lifted to the shoulders and then jerk it above the head and keep it there while maintaining straight legs

concept.name: powerlifting
concept.definition: A strength test where competitors lift as heavy a weight as possible

concept.name: snatch (weightlifting)
concept.definition: The bar must be lifted from floor to above the head in one movement

concept.name: windsurfing
concept.definition: Contestants must complete a marked out course as fast as possible on a windsurf board

concept.name: wrestling
concept.definition: Combat sport where each wrestler attempts to win over his adversary, by holding both shoulders on the ground (fall) long enough to be in control. Points can also be decisive.

concept.name: freestyle wrestling
concept.definition: A style where leg holds are allowed

concept.name: greco-roman
concept.definition: A style where the only holds allowed are those between the head and the belt

concept.name: Swiss wrestling
concept.definition: Traditional Swiss sport similar to wrestling with specific rules

concept.name: wushu
concept.definition: Chinese traditional martial art.

concept.name: disciplinary action in sport
concept.definition: Actions, including fines and suspensions levied by sports organisations and teams

concept.name: drug use in sport
concept.definition: Using drugs to enable competitiveness in sports

concept.name: drug abuse in sport
concept.definition: Using drugs to improve competitiveness in sports

concept.name: drug testing in sport
concept.definition: Means and ways to check the use of drugs in sports

concept.name: medical drug use in sport
concept.definition: Use of drugs for medical reasons as permitted by sport regulators

concept.name: sport event
concept.definition: An event featuring one or more sport competitions

concept.name: continental championship
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from countries from one continent may participate. Called a "Championship".

concept.name: continental cup
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from countries from one continent may participate. Called a "Cup".

concept.name: continental games
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from countries from one continent may participate. Called "Games".

concept.name: international championship
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from different countries may participate. Called a "Championship".

concept.name: international cup
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from different countries may participate. Called a "Cup".

concept.name: international games
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from different countries may participate. Called "Games".

concept.name: national championship
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from one country may participate. Called a "Championship".

concept.name: national cup
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from one country may participate. Called a "Cup".

concept.name: national games
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from one country may participate. Called "Games".

concept.name: regional championship
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from a region of a country may participate. Called a "Championship".

concept.name: regional cup
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from a region of a country may participate. Called a "Cup".

concept.name: regional games
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from a region of a country may participate. Called "Games".

concept.name: world championship
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from the five continents may participate. Called "World Championship".

concept.name: world cup
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from the five continents may participate. Called "World Cup".

concept.name: world games
concept.definition: A competition where individuals or teams from the five continents may participate. Called "World Games".

concept.name: sport industry
concept.definition: Commercial issues related to sport

concept.name: sport organisation
concept.definition: Organisations or associations of sports

concept.name: sport venue
concept.definition: Commercial facility for sporting event

concept.name: weather forecast
concept.definition: Prediction of the course of the weather in the future either near term or long term

concept.name: weather phenomena
concept.definition: Special weather conditions

concept.name: weather statistic
concept.definition: Numerical facts about the weather such as temperature, barometric pressure, river levels, humidity, high and low tides and the like

concept.name: weather warning
concept.definition: Alerts to the general populace about severe weather coming their way

concept.name: cultural policies
concept.definition: Government policies affecting cultural affairs

concept.name: musical
concept.definition: Variation of the musical theater with Anglo-Saxon origins

concept.name: operetta
concept.definition: Variation of the musical theater with Central European origins

concept.name: art exhibition
concept.definition: Temporary presentation of art in museums, art halls or galleries

concept.name: trade fair
concept.definition: Market place to display and trade goods or services

concept.name: stock recommendation
concept.definition: An analyst's recommendation for particular stocks. May include the analyst’s price target for the stock.

concept.name: buy recommendation
concept.definition: An analyst's recommendation to buy particular stocks. May include the analyst’s price target for the stock.

concept.name: hold recommendation
concept.definition: An analyst's recommendation to hold particular stocks. May include the analyst’s price target for the stock.

concept.name: sell recommendation
concept.definition: An analyst's recommendation to sell particular stocks. May include the analyst’s price target for the stock.

concept.name: hot stock
concept.definition: Remarkable price movements of a particular stock.

concept.name: mountaineering
concept.definition: Sportive activities in the mountains including climbing and hiking

concept.name: party
concept.definition: Social event with dancing

concept.name: civilian service
concept.definition: Unpaid service for the community as civilian

concept.name: military service
concept.definition: Mandatory service with the national military for a limited period of time

concept.name: integration policy
concept.definition: Improving the co-existence of groups of the society

concept.name: sports policies
concept.definition: Government policies affecting sports

concept.name: transfer
concept.definition: Change of a member of one team to another team

concept.name: cross-country skiing
concept.definition: Nordic ski race competed in relatively-flat, snowy countryside on narrow skis.

concept.name: Nordic combined
concept.definition: Competition combining cross-country skiing and ski jumping

concept.name: short track speed skating
concept.definition: Races competed by four or more skaters at a time on a small oval ice track
Wettrennen von vier und mehr Eisschnelläufern auf einer kurzen, ovalen Bahn auf Eis.

concept.name: artistic gymnastics
concept.definition: Gymnasts perform artistic and acrobatic moves on different apparatus. There are 6 events for men and 4 for women.

concept.name: Telemark skiing
concept.definition: Races combining downhill and cross-country skiing events with unique Telemark techniques and equipment.

concept.name: chess
concept.definition: Competition between two players using a chequered board with 16 pieces to each side, each with specific ranges of movement depending on their identity.

concept.name: roller sports
concept.definition: Various competitions using wheeled equipment such as roller skates, inline skates, and skateboards.

concept.name: skateboarding
concept.definition: Competitions involving stunts and acrobatic feats performed on a skateboard using various ramps and other obstacles.

schemeMeta.definition: Indicates a subject of an item.
schemeMeta.name: Media Topic
schemeMeta.note: The Media Topic NewsCodes is IPTC's new (as of December 2010) 1100-term taxonomy with a focus on text. The development started with the Subject Codes and extended the tree to 5 levels and reused the same 17 top level terms. The terms below the top level have been revised and rearranged. Each Media Topic provides a mapping back to one of the Subject Codes.
